worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #5287: ARROW-6379: [C++] Write no IPC buffer metadata for NullType
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5287
 
 
   Since we have no integration tests for NullType we have never had to address this issue.
   
   The C++ implementation has been writing 2 `Buffer` Flatbuffer struct values with length 0 for NullType. Rather than having dummy/placeholder Buffer I think it is easier to write no metadata for this type.
   
   The downside of this change is that any persisted record batches from pre 0.15.0 will not be readable. However, we have not made any forward compatibility guarantees about this so I am OK breaking a few eggs on this one. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

wesm commented on issue #5287: ARROW-6379: [C++] Write no IPC buffer metadata for NullType
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5287#issuecomment-528181983
 
 
   cc @emkornfield @tianchen92 @liyafan82 for comments since there is a Java PR up about this.
   
   @trxcllnt @TheNeuralBit is there a JS implementation of this? 
   
   It appears that Go has followed the C++ implementation exactly, so if we accept this change, then we will have to change Go also
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/go/arrow/ipc/writer.go#L231
   
   (cc @sbinet)

wesm commented on issue #5287: ARROW-6379: [C++] Write no IPC buffer metadata for NullType
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5287#issuecomment-533281749
 
 
   After some contemplation I am not sure I want to implement backwards compatibility. To properly do this, we would need to:
   
   * have the `write_legacy_ipc_format` option write the current incorrect format
   * On parsing a message, we would need to set a flag when finding a 4-byte-prefixed old IPC message to use the old NullType format
   
   This seems pretty complicated. I would recommend we skip this

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Currently we send a length-0 buffer. It would be better to not include any buffers.
fields.summary: [C++] Do not append any buffers when serializing NullType for IPC

comments.body: We should discuss this on the mailing list. It would cause old IPC messages containing null types to be unreadable, but we never had integration tests anyway
